snippet: Singling out a major cause of California air pollution, state regulators approved a plan today to cut soot from diesel engines 75 percent over the next decade.    The plan imposes the toughest diesel rules in the nation, requiring filters on new d...
lead_paragraph: Singling out a major cause of California air pollution, state regulators approved a plan today to cut soot from diesel engines 75 percent over the next decade. The plan imposes the toughest diesel rules in the nation, requiring filters on new diesel engines sold in California and the retrofitting of most other diesel engines.
abstract: California regulators approve plan to cut soot from diesel engines 75 percent over next decade; soot is major cause of air pollution in state (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; California Regulators Mandate Diesel Filters
